                    ### Question
                    The 5α reductase inhibitor that has been found to be effective both in benign prostatic hypertrophy and male pattern baldness is:

                    ### Options
                    opa. Flutamide
opb. Finasteride
opc. Prazosin
opd. Minoxidil

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Finasteride is a 5α reductase inhibitor that effectively reduces dihydrotestosterone (DHT) levels, leading to decreased prostate size and improved symptoms of benign prostatic hypertrophy. It also reduces hair follicle miniaturization, improving male pattern baldness. Flutamide, an androgen receptor blocker, has unclear effects on hair and prostate. Prazosin, an alpha-1 adrenergic receptor blocker, improves urinary symptoms in benign prostatic hypertrophy but has no effect on hair. Minoxidil, a vasodilator, increases blood flow to hair follicles, improving male pattern baldness but has no effect on the prostate. The evidence paths confirm the role of DHT in hair follicle structure and prostate function, supporting the effectiveness of finasteride in both conditions.
